main event: Two round-shaped, bright objects were observed flying in a straight course, then suddenly changed direction and disappeared in the Philippines on November 3, 1957.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be flying in a straight and level course before changing direction and disappearing, suggesting advanced maneuverability.
The observation was made by 5 military and civilian personnel at O'Donnell, providing multiple witnesses to the event.
The objects were observed through binoculars and appeared perfectly round, emitting a white light similar to metal reflecting moonlight, with no clouds near the objects.
The magnitude of the objects appeared to be about 6.0 in comparison to known stars, indicating their brightness.
The report suggests that the objects did not move in the sky and appeared to fade out at 2028 hotel time, presenting an unusual behavior.
